references.paper_title: Towards accurate 3d human motion prediction from incomplete observations
references.reason: This paper is foundational to the current work, introducing the concept of predicting human motion from incomplete observations, which is directly extended in the current paper.

references.paper_title: A Stochastic Conditioning Scheme for Diverse Human Motion Prediction
references.reason: This paper is important as it shifts towards diverse or stochastic HMP, generating multiple plausible predictions, a concept directly built upon in the current work.

references.paper_title: Belfusion: Latent diffusion for behavior-driven human motion prediction
references.reason: This is a state-of-the-art method used as a baseline for comparison and highlights the advances in diverse human motion prediction which the current work seeks to improve upon.

references.paper_title: Multimodal sense-informed forecasting of 3d human motions
references.reason: This paper, also authored by some of the current work’s authors, introduces the concept of multimodal sense-informed forecasting which directly informs the work presented here.
This paper is key to the current work as it directly addresses scene-aware motion generation, a challenge explicitly tackled by the current work.
